attributes.action: Save Scotland's Military bases
attributes.background: The Government has decided that 8 of Scotland's Military Bases will close within the the next 16 yrs. This is unacceptable! We in Scotland have some of the best fighting forces in the world, but due to a shortsighted Tory regime, they are going to remove most of our capabilities!

attributes.action: Government should not allow pilots to work on Christmas day
attributes.background:
This is a petition to bring to attention pilots who fly thousands of miles away from their families on the most precious day of the year for many people! 

Help me petition government to put a ban to flying on Christmas day!
attributes.additional_details:
I am surrounded by pilots, many of whom complain about working in Christmas day. The banks shut, so why shouldn't pilots have a "pilot day"? 

I call on government to help pilots and their families spend their day together. 

If pilots are being forced to fly on Christmas day, their families should be rewarded with free flights and accommodation to enable the families to be together. 

Please call on government to make this a possibility!

attributes.action: Small business should not pay employer's NI for employees of state pension age
attributes.background: Employees or Self-Employed of state pension age do not pay NI contributions so why should Employers? I spoke to David Cameron about this and he was intending to look into it but this did not happen due to the EU referendum result

attributes.action: Make a legal requirement for new Vehicles to have automatic emergency braking
attributes.background: To help prevent accidents and deaths on the road by making it a legal requirement for new cars, vans and trucks to have automatic emergency braking systems

attributes.action: i would like to propose one day a year where all commercial flights are banned.
attributes.background: Reports have been released showing the extent that the flight ban after 9/11 had on climate change. These reports show promising figures of an overall drop of average temperature. I believe that by banning non necessary and commercial flights for one day a year could help to slow down global warming
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.greenmedinfo.com/blog/artificial-weather-revealed-post-9-11-flight-groundings 
http://globalnews.ca/news/2934513/empty-skies-after-911-set-the-stage-for-an-unlikely-climate-change-experiment/
i have supplied two sources which both support my claim however many more are available with a simple google search.

attributes.action: Keep the BARRED list, scrap the DBS - help people with convictions get jobs.
attributes.background: Prison, fine or anything other than the lifetime of the DBS which prevents many  British people (not so much foreign nationals) from working, as teachers or within the NHS. It is obvious that the British poor tend to be affected.
attributes.additional_details: It will in the long run cause a deficit in British society as more British people are thrown on to the (never get a job heap).

attributes.action: Stop putting the clocks forward for British Summertime (BST) leave UK on GMT
attributes.background: The clocks changing for British Summertime started 100 years ago. The UK did this when Germany started doing it, apparently it was to save coal. Farmers have lights on their tractors and lights in their cattle sheds so this only serves to cause a nuisance for most of us. Especially those with kids

attributes.action: Pass a law so that EU roaming charges are abolished despite the Brexit vote
attributes.background: The EU has introduce a law to ban roaming charges across the union. However, as UK is leaving those laws won't apply for UK networks and charges will go up. One way is to make a law to stop networks charging for EU roaming. This law could be reciprocal to make negotiations easier.
attributes.additional_details: This law will work by making mobile networks abolish roaming charges or face fines if they fail to do so. This will protect holidaymakers from shock bills. You could also introduce a reciprocal law for EU holidaymakers coming to the UK. This means that EU mobile networks can't charge for roaming in he UK. This will make negotiations easier as it will benefit EU citizens as well.

attributes.action: Negotiate a bespoke reciprocal visa agreement between the UK and the EU
attributes.background: Now the UK voted to leave the EU we will lose the freedom of movement right. This will cease once we leave and will mean we have to apply for a visa to go to the EU on holiday as we are third country nationals. The EU has plans to introduce a £50 holiday visa for citizens of third countries.
attributes.additional_details: This £50 charge is quite expensive for a holiday visa and will deter people going abroad. The only option could be a reciprocal visa agreement between the UK and the EU/EEA. This could mean that UK citizens can travel to the EU, for 180 days, for free. This however, is only possible if we allow all EU nationals coming to the UK the same agreements. We could also include reciprocal emergency healthcare in this visa agreement. This will make it easier for full single market access.

attributes.action: Disallow M.P.s working for firms who have successfully lobbied them as ministers
attributes.background: M.P.s should not profit from their time in office, consorting with firms who lobby them. offering jobs after they leave office, for being compliant with their requests.
attributes.additional_details: Too many M.P.s from the last government and the previous one who held high office went on after losing their seats to take up posts with the very people who had been lobbying them for lucrative  contracts. The health service, television,the eco industry to name a few. M.P.s should be in office to serve the people not feather their nests for the future.

attributes.action: DBS/CRB should be all cleared with in 5years depending on seriousness e.g theft
attributes.background: It's unfair to those who have changed for the good and find it difficult to get employment. If they havn't committed any other offences during crime that took place should be cleared and give a second chance in life.Also depending on the seriousness of the crime. For petty offences should be cleared

attributes.action: Government must do more to help councils build more council homes
attributes.background: The lack of affordable housing is a chronic problem, and has got worse as years have gone on. I became disabled due to a fall at work, and am now in wheelchair. I suffer with chronic pain. I'm stuck in a first floor flat have been trying for years to get a bungalow or ground floor flat with no luck.

attributes.action: Put 5 pence on national Insurance contributions to fund our N.H.S.
attributes.background: Everyone can afford 5pence to save our N.HS dont sit there do something

attributes.action: All councils and H/A should offer any new build properties to existing tenants
attributes.background: all councils and associations should offer new build properties to existing tenants who have lived in older properties for over 10 years and are up to date with the rent accounts in order for them to be able to upgrade and older properties offered to new tenants
attributes.additional_details: Social housing tenants are stuck now if you want to move it's pretty much a no go unless you have exceptional circumstances you could do mutual exchange but if you are in a older house there's little Chance as most want new builds if councils were to offer new builds to existing long term tenants it would mean that if they wanted to upgrade or move area the choice is there new tenants to be offered the older properties

attributes.action: Dedicate more funds to the development of the city of Birmingham.
attributes.background: Too much of the British economy is centered around London. To counter this I suggest dedicating funds to the improvement and expansion of the city of Birmingham as it already has a substantial population, and has the potential to become a new economic and financial hub, strengthening the economy.
attributes.additional_details: The city of San Francisco in the U.S is a major tourist attraction and financial hub, yet it is smaller than Birmingham. If the government was too attract more buisnesses to the area, build more attractions and increase the amount of tall buildings to make it appear more of a global city, then I believe we would see a similar effect. Expanding the airport to fly directly to more cities would also bolster this effect. This would generate far more revenue and give Britain a substantial 2nd city.

attributes.action: Require manufacturers & suppliers to label reduction in size/volume of a product
attributes.background: Since the economic downturn in 2009, manufacturers & suppliers of food & other consumer goods such as washing liquids have been reducing the size or volume of products whilst maintaining the same selling price or increasing it. This results in the consumer paying more money for less goods.
attributes.additional_details: Often the reductions are so subtle, that a consumer is unaware that anything has changed. This practice is misleading & unfair & it is time that manufacturers & suppliers are required to clearly mark a reduction in size or volume. This practice has made the weekly shop much more expensive & by labelling the reduction in size, consumers will be better informed to look at alternative products that may offer better value for money. See examples in this Daily Mail article: https://goo.gl/0aUpQF

attributes.action: Introduce a TV License Discount for Full Time Students
attributes.background: This petition calls on the government to take advantage of the TV license freeze ending in March 2017 to introduce a reduced rate TV license for full time students living in single occupancy rooms. By introducing a reduced rate, more students would consider buying a license.
attributes.additional_details: Unlike a typical home where only one license is needed, students staying in halls of residence are required to purchase an individual license for their room. For example, if a hall has 8 rooms on it, each student is currently required to purchase their own license for just one room at full cost. This is a large amount of money and it is unfair to charge students so much more despite them being on limited budgets. By introducing a reduced rate for single rooms, more students would pay the fee.

attributes.action: Let voters (Eng, Wal, NI) decide if they want Scotland to remain in Britain.
attributes.background: The Scottish had their say on whether they wanted to remain in Britain or not, but the rest of Britain didn't. No one has taken into consideration what the rest of Britain would like to see and it would only be fair for everyone to have an equal say in the out come from both sides. Let us vote!

attributes.action: Introduce a plan of anti-ransomware measures
attributes.background: Ransomware computer viruses target more and more ordinary UK citizens and organizations. Viruses like described here: http://myspybot.com/odin-virus/ cause huge damages. Millions flow away into cyber criminals' pockets. We want to know what is being done to protect us.
attributes.additional_details:
Plenty of things an be done:

 - Government can strengthen cryptocurrencies related laws. For example, make Bitcoin exchange companies keep records of their users.   

- Government can cooperate with security professionals to develop decryption tools.

- Government can introduce stronger online data protection policies. Organizations should create backups of their data.

- Government can raise awareness that we should stop paying to hackers. Make paying immoral and maybe illegal.

attributes.action: Outlaw sale of electronics with firmware reflashing code that can be reflashed
attributes.background: For security, require electronic devices with "reflashable" or other alterable firmware to have the section of code that performs the reflashing, and one that correctly downloads the current reflashable firmware contents, stored in Read Only Memory that is electronically impossible to alter.
attributes.additional_details:
Cyber attacks against hardware have begun to take the form of reflashing attacks which modify the firmware of the targeted device.

If the device's capability to be reflashed can itself be removed or tampered with by reflashing, attack code can make itself undetectable and impossible to remove, requiring the entire electronic device to be thrown away.

The proposal would obstruct this form of attack as fixed unchangable code would exist allow reflashing and reporting of flash memory contents.

attributes.action: 80 characters is not enough to express a political request. Extend limit to >999
attributes.background: I want to write a petition to the government not a twitter comment and I want people to understand from the outset what I want and why. Limiting the number of charterers I can write is extremely restrictive to allowing voters to express themselves.

attributes.action: Stop live music venues being closed by house buyers who chose to live there.
attributes.background: Fewer venues are open for musicians to play in because of home owners who complain AFTER buying.  The venue is then closed. Buyers should sign an acknowledgment of the venue as part of the buying process.
attributes.additional_details: Musicians have few places left to play.  This will be to the detriment of our potentially rich live music future and will effect tourism and local culture.  When all music venues are gone, the same people who complained about noise will bemoan it's loss.

attributes.action: Ban weapons using nanotechnology before they are able to be produced
attributes.background: Nanotechnology could be reality in the next few years and, while there are many benefits of this, the potential of nanotech weapons is too great a threat to humanity to be allowed, these weapons must be banned before they can be produced to prevent the devistation that could arise from their use

attributes.action: Increase Government powers over interest rates to protect savers.
attributes.background: Since 2008 the Bank of England has relentlessly cut interest rates causing savers to lose a considerable amount of income and this has now reached an unacceptable level.  At the moment, the Government has limited power over interest rates.
attributes.additional_details: This petition calls for greater Government powers of the Bank of England's interest rates, so that savers can be protected.

attributes.action: Require proposed Great Reform Bill to give Parliament a veto on terms of BREXIT.
attributes.background: A repeal bill has been proposed to enable BREXIT, as of the date BREXIT takes effect. We propose this bill contain provisions for a Parliamentary vote or referendum approving the terms of BREXIT, and that for the purposes of the Act BREXIT shall not take effect until such approval has been given.
attributes.additional_details: We the people have the undisputed right, per the 2016 referendum to leave the EU. If the terms of leaving are unacceptable, it should neither be disputed that we have the right to change our minds. While it appears the Prime Minister intents to trigger article 50 without Parliamentary consent or knowledge of a likely deal, Parliament and the people can be given a say by the mechanism described above. The Act means the proposed Great Repeal Bill referred to by Mrs May in Conference on 02/10/2016.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for the press to use entrapment to produce 'sensational' stories
attributes.background:
It is too easy for journalists to entrap an unsuspecting victim into revealing information that they wouldn't volunteer if they knew that they were talking to the press.
This can cause people to lose their jobs or cause humiliation
It is deceitful and fraudulent. But is it in the public interest.
attributes.additional_details:
Sex Scandals, Politicians, Celebrities. The only reason they do it is to increase their market share, yet claim it is in the public interest.
This could ruin an aspiring politician, business person or celebrity for a good scoop.
Most recent case is Sam Alerdice, the former England Manager, who revealed some embarrassing 'trade secrets' to what he thought were businessmen, but were gutter press.

attributes.action: Drones need unique reg number created by manufacturer which is assigned to buyer
attributes.background:
Problem is there is currently no way of matching a Drone with an owner.

Worse case was a Drone which collided with a British Airway flight over Heathrow. Story covered on 18th April, 2016 - Daily Telegraph
attributes.additional_details:
Daily Telegraph

http://www.telegraph.co.uk/technology/2016/04/18/drone-laws-in-the-uk--what-are-the-rules/

BBC

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-35442130

attributes.action: Close or take drastic measures to improve the 111 nhs service.
attributes.background: The NHS 111 service continually provide incorrect information and put people's lives at risk and put extra strain on the hospitals, doctors and the ambulance service. They also don't listen to what the problem is , they read a computer screen.

attributes.action: Require by law Landlords/Ladies to change mattresses between different tenants.
attributes.background: Hi. I'm just another student in the London renting market. Yep, that open sewer of real estate. Thanks to not being provided a new mattress when I moved in to a property, I have had both fleas and bedbugs. I am asking that the government require new mattresses for new tenants.
attributes.additional_details:
When I moved into a property two years ago my mattress had been left in the shed for a "few" days whilst work was done on my room. Instead of receiving a new mattress I got the old one from the previous tenant, plus some new friends - fleas! 
This year, I moved into a property and discovered the old mattress was infested with bed bugs! Thanks previous tenant! 
Whilst it may be expensive to replace mattresses, no tenant should have to live through bug infestations.

attributes.action: Give British people a say in our post-referendum relationship with the EU
attributes.background: The EU referendum gave the option of leaving or remaining in the EU. The options in reality are more nuanced and there is a risk of the British populace getting an unsatisfactory outcome. Given the lies of the pre-referendum campaigning we need honesty about the future of Britain and further say.
attributes.additional_details:
We need to know, and have a say on:
Whether further austerity measures might be necessary after leaving the EU: www.just-fair.co.uk/#!United-Nations-Austerity-policies-breach-the-UK%E2%80%99s-international-human-rights-obligations/qbw0c/577384fa0cf231749dc9f955
How immigration will be affected www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-37271420
Whether the NHS will be better off by £350 million per week
Whether the United Kingdom will split up
How our successful science base will be protected

attributes.action: Ban group interviews for all job applicants in the UK
attributes.background:
In the harsh times we live in, employment and specifically, unemployment is one of the most painful things a person can face.
The indignity of group interviews where people are made to beg around a table for jobs, is unfair.
We need to empower jobseekers, not crush them and ban group interviews.
attributes.additional_details:
Group interviews are by many seen as a lazy recruitment practise, to root out 'unworthy' candidates quickly.
In many cases, I find group interviews to be discriminatory and unfair to certain demographics.
Paid employment is and should be for everyone.
One of the major flaws with group interviews is that introverted personality types are left out in the cold. 
We need to introduce a fairer system that forces employers to evenly and fairly judge ALL potential job candidates.

attributes.action: Change length of time that offences stay on a persons criminal record to 10 yrs
attributes.background: If an offence stays on your record for life you're punished for life. The law should be changed so that if no further crimes are committed after 10 years the offence should be removed from there basic record. Enhanced checks for work places with children/vulnerable adults should stay permanently.
attributes.additional_details: Any offence with a 30 month+ sentence stays on record for life regardless of the type of crime/number of offences committed. Yes people need to be punished for breaking the law but if there sentence is served and they commit no further crimes they should be able to move on and build a life. People cannot get jobs because of their record and end up re-offending, homeless and with mental health issues. Changing the law will reduce crime rates, improve peoples well-being.

attributes.action: The import and personal use of DMT-containing plant materials should be legal.
attributes.background: While the Psychoactive Substances Act 2016 is right to ban some dangerous legal highs, a blanket ban is ill-considered. Personal use and import of DMT-containing plant materials, in their natural form, should be legal, especially since the possession of said item is NOT a crime under this new act.
attributes.additional_details:
Certain plants and plant materials found in nature have long been used for curing depression, learning about consciousness and developing spirituality for those who find religion ineffective. Plants used for 'Ayahuasca' have powerful healing properties and have been used by many to help overcome depression, anxiety and stress. Personal use can allow people to study spirituality, the nature of our existence and consciousness as a right of their freedom.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ayahuasca

attributes.action: To ban electronic cigarettes in all public places in England.
attributes.background: They have not been around long enough for scientist to say whether electronic cigarettes cause harm to individuals. Young people are using them as a fashion accessory, not to give up smoking.
attributes.additional_details:
There are a couple of young people in my office at work, who compares the different flavors they have tried and how much they like them.  This is not encouraging them to give up.

There is nothing worse than seeing someone smoking them in a public place, the substance coming out of them is absolutely disgusting.

attributes.action: Remove from doctors working within the NHS the right to strike.
attributes.background: I am a patient with two incurable deteriorating brain conditions. I have waited for six months for three appointments all of which are likely to be cancelled. I have followed the negotiations  closely and have very reluctantly come to the conclusion that the BMA  are being highly irresponsible.
attributes.additional_details:
Three reasons:
1) In May of this year the BMA representative described the new contract as a deal "All sides can sign up to" and that "Doctors can be confident in this new contract". They now say the contract is so bad there have to be massive damaging strikes.
2)There has been a large drop in support for the BMA's militant stance. Of the 54,000 members only a minority 21540 voted to reject the new contract. This is down from 98% at the start of the dispute. A responsible union would re-ballot its members.
3) The BMA have consistently refused to take action such as legal action which would not damage patients and would win their dispute.

attributes.action: Allow workers to continue to sacrifice their salaries in exchange for safer cars
attributes.background: The Daily Mail have reported today that "The Treasury’s proposed rules could come into force next April and would effectively kill off tax benefits worth thousands of pounds a year for company car drivers. Under the plans, workers would be taxed . . ."
attributes.additional_details: Salary sacrifice schemes are the only way some people would ever be able to drive a nice car - you see far fewer "old bangers" on the road nowadays. These schemes must be hugely beneficial to car manufacturers and all associated industries.

attributes.action: Ask the Government to issue a medal to the wounded military serving personnel.
attributes.background: Unlike the United States who issue the Purple Heart Medal, the British Armed Services do not recognize the sacrifices made by those who serve and are wounded or killed during their service by way of a special medal. We believe it is shameful that such a medal does not exist and needs to be rectified
attributes.additional_details: We ask the British Government to create a special medal to be awarded to servicemen and servicewomen who, while serving under competent authority in any capacity with one of the UK Armed Forces has been wounded or killed. We also ask that the Government consider that this medal be posthumously awarded to qualifying servicemen and servicewomen who have been wounded or killed since the 28th July 1914.

attributes.action: help with more funding for veterans with PTSD and family's
attributes.background: Currently change step have been denied extra funding to carry on providing a mentoring service for veterans suffering PTSD and families, by losing this much needed service, this could have a negative impact on the mental health issues of veterans,
attributes.additional_details:
Change Step, based in Colwyn Bay, Conwy county, said 29 workers would lose their jobs following an unsuccessful bid for further funding.
The charity said it was still "determined to carry on".
The Ministry of Defence, which awarded the charity £995,918 in 2013, said it could apply for further funding "in the coming months and years".

attributes.action: Ban all HGVs from the third lane of all motorways
attributes.background: Motorway expansion was meant to increase traffic flow but, with lorries using lanes 1 2 and 3, traffic bunches up causing congestion

attributes.action: Manual workers to retire at 60!!
attributes.background:
We work until we drop!! Is that the idea? Myself and my partner are both manual workers and are 57 years old!! We really can't see ourselves being fit to work until we're 66!! Can you? We're ready to drop now.

Please vote.
attributes.additional_details: Manual workers are more at risk for potential damage to limb and arthritis damage so therefore would cost more in the long run for medical deficiency!! Most of us will end up taking sick leave because we can't manage our jobs. Personally I have worked since I was 14 and am now 57. Is this not long enough!!!

attributes.action: Make ALL schools teach kids the dangers of the railway.
attributes.background:
We all know that the railway is a dangerous place, however people still do not understand this and are running across the tracks at stations, laying on the tracks or even playing chicken at level crossings.

Last year 332 people died after trespassing onto the railway tracks in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
Now kids think it's right to play on the railway and ignore all the safety rules displayed around the tracks. 

If schools teach kids that it's dangerous to play on or around the railway then the figures might go down and there will be less deaths.

attributes.action:
make it mandatory to show on ALL products:
- manufacturer
- origin
attributes.background:
Please make it mandatory for all products sold in the UK to display
- manufacturer name
- country of origin
this should apply to products sold under supermarkets' name as well.
for example 
fridge from electronic shop chain named Sandstorm does not show manufacturer and its country of origin!

attributes.action: An NHS research investment donation app for mobile phones and computers.
attributes.background: Well I have ulcerative colitis and every time I go to hospital I notice there are a lot of people who would like to be able to do more and feel as if they can do nothing at least with a app people can send money to invest in research in areas where they would like to see improvements in research.
attributes.additional_details: I don't feel evidence is something needed in this case. Good people invest in good things and this is one of them.

attributes.action: Address the rise in incidences of dangerous driving on UK roads.
attributes.background: There is a lack of deterrent for dangerous drivers on UK roads. Speeding, illegal manoeuvring and blatant disregard for the Highway Code seem to have become common-place. The UK needs to rethink it's reliance on speed cameras, speed humps, etc. and begin enforcing speed and dangerous driving laws.

attributes.action: Make all drivers carrying passengers for reward take the DVSA Practical & CPC
attributes.background: At present it is optional if licensing authorities make new hackney/ph drivers take a dvsa test. I call for all drivers present and new of any licensing borough to ensure all drivers complete a dvsa practical, hazard perception & cpc. All other professional drivers have to and only equal they do to.
attributes.additional_details: Road safety is becoming harder to tackle across the UK, if we lead the way in Europe on how to maintain road safety by ensuring all drivers who drive for hire & reward take the steps as bus & lorry drivers have then we are one step closer to ensuring safety of passengers in any Taxi/PH vehicle & other road users for social, domestic, pleasure, commercial & business use too. Where the public are concerned this is vital for road safety and passenger reassurance that drivers are trained correctly.

attributes.action: Add safeguards to §111A (Enterprise & Regulatory Reform Act 2013) for employees.
attributes.background:
The current laws regarding 'Settlement Agreements' or 'Without Prejudice Conversations' or 'Protected Conversations' or 'Off the record Conversations' are shockingly lacking in safeguards for the employee.

They can be sprung upon an employee as a way of getting rid of them without red tape.
attributes.additional_details:
They are being used currently by employers as a way to place 'no other options decisions' on the employee and there is not enough safeguarding process to resolve relationship issues through other steps first. Much like you can't go to tribunal without a certificate from ACAS, employers should not be allowed to have these types of conversation without all possible other avenues exhausted first.

I'm not suggesting that the option shouldn't be there, it should just be limited to the final ones.

attributes.action: Bring university fees down to £4.5 grand a year
attributes.background: People either can't or never pay the money if the government wants their money back they need to bring the fees down

attributes.action: Implement driving evaluations to make UK roads safer
attributes.background: Driving evaluations should become a regular requirement in the UK. By introducing a standard driving evaluation every 5 years (approx.) to deem drivers 'safe to drive', road fatalities and casualties should decrease, and the overall safety level of the roads should improve.
attributes.additional_details:
There was a recorded 24,610 people killed or seriously injured in car accidents between 1st April 2015 - 31st March 2016.

Motor traffic levels have increased 1.8% in the rolling year. It is important to ensure road safety is at the highest levels.

https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/543662/quarterly-estimates-january-to-march-2016.pdf

attributes.action: Force Manufacturers of all goods to make warranties transferable.
attributes.background: I wanted to buy a lens that's only 4 months old. The maker told me that the 12 month warranty isn't transferable and applies to the original purchaser only.  Common with consumer goods. I think they should simply have to guarantee the product for a period of time regardless of changes in ownership.

attributes.action: Allow fathers to stay with poorly babies in hospitals
attributes.background: on 3rd August 2016 my 4 day old daughter was rushed to hospital because she wasn't breathing properly, once we were seen we were sent to a ward, where I (Father) was told I had to leave her and go home because the ward was for women.
attributes.additional_details: I was forced to leave my baby in the hospital because they ward staff would not allow me to stay with her. I believe men should be allowed to stay with their children regardless!
